snippet: The case stems from various requirements imposed on abortion providers and clinics that critics say would force most clinics in the state to close.
abstract: Supreme Court justices appear split during arguments in case regarding Texas abortion law, with four liberal justices indicating that restrictions placed on abortion providers serve no medical purpose; Justice Anthony M Kennedy, who is likely to hold pivotal vote, seems to suggest case could be returned to lower court; even 4-to-4 vote tie, in light of Justice Antonin Scalia's death, would have enormous consequences and could affect millions of women.
lead_paragraph: The case stems from various requirements imposed on abortion providers and clinics that critics say would force most clinics in the state to close.

headline.main: Supreme Court Appears Sharply Divided as It Hears Texas Abortion Case
headline.print_headline: Justices Split in Arguments Over Abortion
